document.masterDocTitle: Revision of world Austroterobiinae and Parasaphodinae (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Pteromalidae), parasitoids of giant scales (Hemiptera: Coccoidea: Monophlebidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of world Austroterobiinae and Parasaphodinae (Hymenoptera: Chalcidoidea: Pteromalidae), parasitoids of giant scales (Hemiptera: Coccoidea: Monophlebidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
T. eirene
Heydon, 2004 : 184
–186; holotype in UCD, examined.

subSubSection.paragraph:
The females of
T. eirene
are very similar to those of
T. africana
(see diagnosis of the latter species).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 91, 92.
Teasienna eirene
, holotype ♀: 91, habitus, lateral view; 92, ♀, habitus, dorsal view.

FIGURES 93–99.
Teasienna eirene
: 93, holotype ♀, head, frontal view; 94, holotype ♀, head, dorsal view; 95, holotype ♀, head, lateral view; 96, holotype ♀, mesosoma, dorsal view; 97, paratype ♀, India, mesosoma, lateral view; 98, paratype ♀, India, propodeum, dorsal view; 99, holotype ♀, fore wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: Sculpture. Head and mesosoma smooth to finely coriaceous-alutaceous ( Figs 93–98 ); gaster smooth.
Distribution. India ( Heydon 2004 ); Indonesia , Thailand , Vietnam (new records).
